data.name: Collings_CL_Deluxe_Description
data.value:
Crafted with the finest seasoned maple and Honduran mahogany, the CL Deluxe is built for tone. Lightweight, resonant mahogany combined with a carefully hand-set mortise and tenon neck joint bring tonal complexity and sustain to the table in spades. The CL Deluxe features ivoroid neck and peghead binding and our custom ivoroid "top hat" knobs and pickup rings. Sleekly contoured for comfort and style, we've brought new life to an American classic.

Premium Tonewoods

Each Collings Deluxe electric guitar is constructed of all solid woods that are acquired, acclimated, and hand selected for acoustical response by master luthiers here at our shop.

Electronics

With an airy top end and a balanced midrange, Lollar Imperials employ unbalanced coils to create a tight bass response with the full bodied character and complex overtones of the best original PAF pickups.

Playability

A combination of exacting PLEK machine leveling and hand fret dressing ensures consistently excellent playability and a silky fret feel.

Finish

By meticulously hand-sanding between coats, our nitrocellulose lacquer finishes measure between .005 and .007 thousandths in final thickness, maximizing acoustical response while providing excellent protection.

Hardware

Collings Deluxe electrics feature Gotoh SG301 tuners and Tonepros tune-o-matic bridges and stop tailpieces.

Deluxe Appointments

Custom ivoroid knobs and pickup rings are handmade in our shop and only available on a Collings Deluxe electric.

Exotic Tops

Deluxe Series electrics can be ordered with quilted maple, mahogany, flamed koa, and other exotic top wood varieties for a look and tone custom tailored to your style.

Make It Your Own

With a wide variety of available custom inlays, tremolos, bridges, neck profiles, and tone wood options; a Collings electric can be configured to perfectly match your playing style and aesthetic preference.

data.name: McNaught_VDC_Description
data.value:
The McNaught Vintage Double Cut is a Mahogany solid body carved top guitar with a Mahogany 'SET-THRU' neck and 'All-Access' heel. It features a flame Maple bound Indian Rosewood fingerboard with 12\" radius, 22 frets, 24 3/4\" compensated scale length, Mother Of Pearl 'Offset Block' inlays, Tone Pros Tune-O-Matic bridge, Sperzel locking tuners, Wagner Dual humbuckers, 1 11/16\" nut, matching wood cavity covers, and a standard form-fitted case.

Available custom upgrades include:

  • Diamond Carved Flame Top
  • Diamond Carved Quilt Top
  • Exotic Wood Tops
  • Wood Binding on Body
  • Wood Binding on Headstock
  • Black Limba Body and Neck
  • Kingwood Fingerboard
  • Ebony Fingerboard
  • Birdseye Maple Fingerboard
  • Brazilian Fingerboard
  • Maple Neck
  • Tone Chambers
  • Hipshot Tremolo
  • Floyd Rose Tremolo
  • Piezo System
  • String Thru
  • Flame Maple Pickup Rings
  • Direct Mount Pickups
  • 24 Fret
  • 25 ½\" Scale
  • 25\" Scale

List price is $4,800 while street price is $3,600.

data.name: PRS_Custom24_Description
data.value:
The Custom 24 is the quintessential PRS guitar. This iconic instrument was the first model that Paul Reed Smith brought to the public at PRS Guitars’ first Winter NAMM show in 1985 and has been a top seller ever since. Played by internationally touring artists, gigging musicians, and aspiring players, the Custom 24 features PRS’s patented tremolo system and PRS 85/15 treble and bass pickups with volume and tone controls and a 5-way blade switch. 85/15 pickups were personally designed by Paul Reed Smith for PRS’s 30th Anniversary. They offer remarkable clarity and extended high and low end.

The Custom 24 is the original PRS. Since its introduction, it has offered a unique tonal option for serious players and defined PRS tone and playability.

Guitarists looking for additional options, colors, and enhanced features can order a Custom 24 Artist Package.

Pickup Switching Positions:

Position One: Bridge humbucker
Position Two: Bridge humbucker with neck singlecoil, in parallel
Position Three: Bridge and neck humbuckers
Position Four: Neck singlecoil with bridge singlecoil, in parallel
Position Five: Neck humbucker

Mahogany body and neck.
